data.text: Today the UK leaves the EU, but our future prosperity remains connected. Despite the challenges of the last 3 years, together we have made progress. Now the real work begins. It’s time to focus on the future and build a new relationship with Europe.

Great insights from @AsifSadiq Head of Diversity Inclusion & Belonging for @Telegraph. Delivering a positive working environment where all people can truly be themselves should be a board level priority for every business. https://t.co/kMhgPLyRxj

Today's @sainsburys announcement is a significant investment and a bold step. 🇬🇧 will reach net zero by 2050 if government & business work together. This is a welcome demonstration of the scale of action needed and shows how committed business is to rising to the challenge.#COP26 https://t.co/Ya8dfVta3M

Great example of leadership from @Tesco. Reaching #netzero & protecting our planet isn't going to happen overnight. It will only happen if business stands up & plays its part, taking consumers along with us. #COP26 https://t.co/r7cmzFGOWb

RT @CBItweets: 🇬🇧 needs an immigration system that works on day 1. 

We look forward to working with the new government to inform the desig…

We will only meet the climate challenge if business steps up and does its part. That's why it is so great to see major 🇬🇧businesses like @AstraZeneca announce their plan to reach #netzero by 2025 & ensure their entire supply chain is carbon negative by 2030. #COP26 https://t.co/Q6Ye3wvZkP

Powerful words from António Horta-Osório’ on his experience of stress at work - helping people realise everyone’s human and mental health really matters. Business takes this v seriously - @DeloitteUK's data is a reminder more is needed to support people to be their best at work. https://t.co/ydFw6W37nI

Today's announcement of 1000 new jobs by @Facebook is an endorsement of 🇬🇧's tech sector. As we move into a new decade UK has the ideas and tech to take on our productivity challenge. Find out more 👉https://t.co/cWXWMGf3Pl https://t.co/LgL40UTXrE
As the new year opens business’ has been taking stock of what the new decade and a new Government mean for them.  @EveningStandard 👇https://t.co/TkUlcFc5W6

Great to see @Microsoft setting a bold, ambitious goal. Climate leadership can drive competitiveness & secure prosperity. We can only reach #netzero by 2050 if Government & business work together. #COP26 is an opportunity to show 🇬🇧 as a world leader. Let's deliver, together. https://t.co/cSCO0vG5dl

Business welcomes @sajidjavid’s ambitious vision for the economy. A good 🇪🇺 deal can support that. For some divergence brings value but for many others alignment supports competitiveness and jobs. Insight from enterprise will be essential for these complex decisions. https://t.co/DtDbZGax85

After 3 years of under-investment & political stalemate, this bold & ambitious deal is what Northern Ireland needed to get back on its feet. A strong voice from NI has never been more important. It’s time to reaffirm NI’s reputation as a great place to do business https://t.co/vE5UrMBj4U

It’s great news that @SeetecInspire has become one of the largest employee-owned companies in the UK. An engaged workforce is fundamental for the success of any business and will bring many benefits. https://t.co/XKzxFYmyga
🍶@yeovalley is a real South West success story. Great to see their dairy today and hear about their exciting plans for the future! https://t.co/GUxpq24yg5

Delighted to hear from a diverse range of CBI members at lunch today. Especially pleased to hear about the work being done on Great South West, another example of what we can achieve when business & Govemement work together. Thanks to @FootAnstey for hosting the discussion. https://t.co/70XV1xQZA6
RT @CBItweets: Kicking off a two-day conversation with businesses in the South West, @cbicarolyn is hosting a lunch with members. First ite…

Today’s @WEF’s Global Gender Gap data is a stark reminder that while UK firms have made progress there is so much more to do. These results must spur real change - especially in tech, science & engineering sectors that have such rewarding jobs to offer. We can & must do better. https://t.co/mQhUSKZ90q

Business & Government must meet the challenge of climate change & get to net zero by 2050. 🇬🇧 can be a world leader in emissions reduction. As hosts of #COP26 UK has an opportunity to lead the charge. Business is ready to play its leading role in delivering the change we need. https://t.co/MM086CjIqr
RT @CBItweets: Business have needed greater certainty for 3 years now. The election result has started to bring that. It will bring some gr…

Congratulations @BorisJohnson & @Conservatives. Business urges PM to use strong mandate to rebuild confidence & break cycle of uncertainty, starting with reassurance on Brexit. Historic moment for new contract between business & government to drive new era of inclusive growth.
RT @CBItweets: Local businesses do so much to support our economy. Here is to the strivers who have built something from nothing, employing…

Great moment for @astonmartin & Wales. This factory will support hundreds of jobs directly with many more supported in the supply chain - helping to deliver prosperity in South Wales. Look forward to seeing the DBX on the road! https://t.co/qYov0DA2TH

Fantastic day today with @discoverRB opening their new science centre in Hull – a new jewel in crown of British innovation. Next government has golden opportunity to increase R&D investment and establish UK as the global home of science, invention, and discovery. https://t.co/khRGE0kul6
Sky’s new studio will drive jobs & add £3 billion to the 🇬🇧 economy. It’s a great vote of confidence in UK creative industries & in @elstreeStudios. https://t.co/AaRr9PBS8y

RT @CBItweets: We can’t solve the climate emergency by simply making it someone else’s problem. @CBICarolyn speaking at the CBI #racetonetz…

Huge congratulations to Katherine Bennett @Westminstrwings @Airbus VP & CBI International Chair for appointment to chair Western Gateway transport partnership in SW. A vital role that will show how Government & business can work together to drive regional growth & prosperity.

This election must be about tackling the biggest problems of our day: climate change; inequality; preparing our young people for a changing economy. None of this can be done without business in partnership with government. All politicians should be shouting this from the rooftops

This may be a winter election but it must thaw our frozen economy. Politicians must seize chance to break Brexit deadlock, relaunch 🇬🇧 as a great place to do business & replace ideology with evidence. The prize is a more prosperous & fairer UK for generations to come.

RT @portsmouthuni: The panel for Any Questions @BBCPolitics @BBCRadio4 #bbcaq hosted by @ChrisMasonBBC with @ConorBurnsUK @cbicarolyn
@tnew…
RT @harrycanderson: Great to be at the launch of new @CBItweets report into the importance of our creative industries with @cbicarolyn and…

Finally, a deal has won in the Commons. An extension is now vital for business and our country. It must be agreed immediately. To refuse it would be an act of great economic harm. Politicians must then work together to find a way through this enduring mess.

A cautious welcome from business for the brexit deal.
 - welcome: avoiding no deal and delivering transition brings vital stability
- caution: if this is a gateway to a basic FTA it won’t work for uk economy
Govt must build future relationship from economic evidence. https://t.co/6SKA8UwckJ

Agreement between @BorisJohnson & @EUCouncil is a significant step. Compromise on both sides has been vital & welcome. Avoiding a damaging no deal & securing transition is critical. But devil lies in detail, especially on regulatory alignment & services. CBI reviewing carefully.
RT @CER_EU: Standing room only for the @CER_EU fringe event at the Conservative Party conference - "What route out of the Brexit maze?" wit…

.@sajidjavid put his money on a modern, connected, low carbon economy which is exactly what business wanted to hear. But it feels like a page was missing from his speech. It was silent on how government would respond to the rupture caused by failing to secure a deal with the EU.

RT @CBItweets: The business concern about no deal Brexit is not project fear. We need a deal. We are urging compromise across all political…
People need facts not fiction on Brexit. That includes talking about the real impact the prospect of a no deal Brexit is having on business and our economy. https://t.co/KJTyM49Edg

This is not war, it’s a call for compromise from the heart of business 
to government. While Westminster churns in turmoil, the clock ticks 
down to No Deal. Real consequences are being felt by 000s of 
businesses worried about their future https://t.co/iU2EzsO1pt
Ready or not, No Deal will harm business across Europe for years to come.

Myth #3: It’s not true that No Deal ends uncertainty for business. 
No Deal makes uncertainty worse with endless arguments on tariffs, borders, Ireland, rules. A swamp as well as a cliff edge.

Myth #2: It's not true that the impact of No Deal can be eliminated
➡️Retailers have prepared but cannot guarantee no delays or food shortages. 
➡️Car industry facing 10% tariffs - will be smaller and mean fewer jobs.

Myth #1: It’s not true that business is or can be ‘ready’ for No Deal. 
 
➡️@fsb_policy surveys show majority small firms not prepared due to cost & complexity . 
➡️Even big firms that are ‘ready’ will be damaged.
People deserve fact not fiction about the impact of No Deal Brexit on 🇬🇧 business.  #FactCheck

Labour conference passes with no mention of the value business brings to 🇬🇧: the jobs they create, the people they train, the innovation they deliver. Instead, firms have faced a volley of attacks, on sectors from life sciences to utilities. This is desperately disappointing.

A growing economy built on fairness can only be delivered if business and government work together. The policies @johnmcdonnellMP announced today risk hanging a closed sign on the door of our open economy.

Huge congratulations from all of us at CBI to Alison Rose on becoming @RBS new CEO. Alison will do an incredible job - and great to see an amazing woman in the role, the first female CEO of a big four bank.
Great to visit @SAFRAN today in Wales. Always great to visit businesses that are at the heart of their communities. @SafranSeats https://t.co/7c7c63Xcgl

Great to be in Ireland with @LeoVaradkar. No matter what happens with Brexit the bonds between UK & Irish business will continue to strengthen. But a no-deal Brexit would put unnecessary strain on our vital partnership. We need a deal. https://t.co/8XuPwO7Yb6

Commons votes offer chink of light for economy - extension preferable to harm of no deal. But with potential election still looming and no agreed deal, the Brexit clock keeps ticking. Any extra time must bring compromise. Political chaos mustn’t become economic chaos.
RT @CBItweets: CBI members understand that politicians are facing desperately hard choices and want them to hear the economic evidence dire…

I have spent recent weeks speaking to 100s of businesses across 🇬🇧 from entrepreneurs to multinationals, retailers to tech start-ups. They are united in one message for the government: strain every sinew to get a Brexit deal with the EU. https://t.co/CGTVIJ4RZI

I've arrived in Newcastle to hear from CBI members of all sizes about their Brexit preparations. Will be meeting with retailers, universities, manufacturers, exporters, & our services sector. https://t.co/6QZpyb5if2

This morning I’m in Glasgow -  🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿Scotland’s largest city & a thriving hub of industry - hearing from CBI members about their preparations for a no-deal Brexit and what it would mean for their business. https://t.co/vBTvd09EKs

This week I’m travelling to every region and nation of UK. I'll be hearing from firms about their preparations for a no-deal Brexit and the impact on their business.

A true friend of the CBI, @GregClarkMP has led the way on business engagement. Through the Industrial Strategy we have made real progress in laying the foundations for growth in every region and nation of 🇬🇧. https://t.co/2dJrwvtsOE

Congratulations @BorisJohnson. Business shares your enthusiasm - now the hard work begins. Business is counting on you for the right trading conditions You can count on us to invest, innovate & build a great economy. Together we can create the shared prosperity 🇬🇧 deserves.

Thank you @PhilipHammondUK for your wisdom and courage in steering the UK economy in challenging times. CBI members have appreciated your considered approach to policy and commitment to sound public finances. https://t.co/Z6T4JmzBQa

No one can doubt @theresa_may's steadfast commitment to public service and the good of the country. She leaves office with the respect of business, and my personal thanks, for her resilience and integrity in hard times.
RT @CBILeaders: @CBILeaders successful leaders are able to respond to and embrace change, in whatever forms it comes.  We are looking forwa…

Congratulations @BorisJohnson. Significant opportunities ahead. Business and Government can get 🇬🇧 economy back on track. Seize the chance to show the UK is open for business. Restore confidence in our economy. Together we can deliver for every region and nation in the UK.
Congratulations @joswinson on becoming the new leader of @LibDems. Working together we can grow 🇬🇧 economy & deliver prosperity, shared.

Imagine what we can achieve: a global, open, and safe city, where all are welcome to start and run a business – powered by clean energy – where jobs and opportunities can change lives. https://t.co/UhdAYHILEW

Delighted to meet @EmmanuelMacron  today as proud representative of 🇬🇧 business at #B7 🇫🇷 Summit
 
The delegation of CBI members, including @HSBC @VodafoneGroup @AirbusintheUK & @ScotchWhiskySWA, voiced strong support for a UK-EU trade partnership that delivers shared prosperity. https://t.co/A5dRVPHqg8

Great to meet with the delegation from @FollowCII today. UK and India ties are strong but there is so much more we can do. By working together we can deliver trade, jobs and prosperity in both countries. https://t.co/lAw2AxoVzC
Incredibly moving service today for Lord Heywood of Whitehall. He was a great man and a great friend of business who made everyone feel they mattered.  Feel privileged to have known him.

Constructive meeting with @BorisJohnson today. No matter who becomes next PM there’s a huge amount to do.  In partnership, government and business can deliver prosperity for everyone, in every region of 🇬🇧

Working together we can deliver an immigration system that restores public confidence & meets the needs of our economy. It’s great to see @ukhomeoffice working together with business to find the answers. #openandcontrolled https://t.co/YZyTHhXmgs

Business stands squarely behind Government’s commitment to reach net-zero emissions by 2050. 🇬🇧 can and must be a world leader in fixing the #ClimateCrisis. Now let’s work together to get the action plan to make it happen.
Really pleased at the recognition that business is a vital part of solving society’s challenges. Thanks to all CBI colleagues and members. https://t.co/16Pl7xGv6T

.@theresa_may could not have worked harder to deliver a Brexit deal that protects the economy. She leaves office with the respect of business. But her resignation must be a catalyst for change. There can be no plan for Britain without a plan for Brexit.
Great to have chance to catch up with the brilliant @cbi_ni team ahead of tonight’s Northern Ireland Annual dinner #cbiad19 https://t.co/Bh0lZSS04f
RT @CBItweets: Twenty years ago, when the Irish border was opened, this island’s economy began to change. Political division was bridged by…
RT @CBItweets: There will never be a better route out of poverty than a good job.  Across gender and race.  Region and class.  Overcoming d…

Great to be speaking today at @TCCBusinessDept  In these uncertain times, the opportunity for business leaders to be champions for inclusion, diversity and fairness in the workplace #TrinityBusiness https://t.co/9l0F18YctU

Brexit has left the economy stranded in no man’s land. The PM’s offer provides a way forward, but only MPs can take it. Businesses urge them finally to find the spirit of compromise that has eluded them so far. Jobs and livelihoods depend on it.

Another day of failed politics, another dispiriting day for business. Uncertainty continues to paralyse our economy. May parliamentary recess must be cancelled and used to agree a deal asap. Business and the UK need an urgent resolution to this mess. It’s time to get on with it.

Improving productivity is not about people working harder or longer. It’s about ingraining the kind of management practices that enable employees to be and give their best. Putting people management on an equal footing with commercial targets - https://t.co/KlHCw1IPMC

Customs often misunderstood – the letter today is a prime example. A new EU/UK customs deal with shared external tariffs would bring many benefits to economy. Must be time for compromise & no more red lines
RT @RussShaw1: Great to have @cbicarolyn @CBItweets addresses @TechLondonAdv #InvestorShowcase2 @HereEast via video https://t.co/nURzAuVPaG

This new extension means imminent economic crisis has been averted, but it needs to mark a fresh start. For the good of jobs and communities across the country, all political leaders must use the time well. Sincere cross-party collaboration must happen now to end this chaos.

RT @brexitbroadcast: NEW PODCAST: Inside the Cabinet🎙️

@christopherhope is joined by Health Secretary @MattHancock, who tells us about the…

Business can be a powerful force for good by helping women succeed in all walks of life. Gender pay reporting must be a catalyst for change. It’s crucial firms take concrete action & talk openly about how they are closing their pay gaps.

PM has opened door to desperately needed compromise. For sake of UK jobs and prosperity, we urge every politician today to walk through it in good faith. This is national emergency - only answer Is national unity.

Welcome steps must be breakthrough not false dawn. Business confidence slumping, growth stalled & UK reputation in tatters. Tories must compromise on red lines & Labour come to table in good faith. No excuses, no time wasting, no party politics. Enough is enough.

Still no majority. Desperately disappointing. But a way forward is emerging. A mutually beneficial customs union with the EU could build consensus and can’t be ignored. Government must listen and act. Threat of no deal cannot be allowed to undermine economy any longer.
Another day of despair for business. Politics fail again while the economy suffers. This is inexcusable. MPs must compromise and find a deal that supports jobs.

Our economy is in the emergency zone. Business clear on message to MPs - https://t.co/m1YLr32NJV. Rule out no deal and Canada FTA, agree a workable deal for frictionless trade/access for services. Counting on MPs to put jobs and economy first.
RT @CBItweets: Thanks to @Keir_Starmer for coming to speak to CBI members today. Members discussed both the Brexit process and Labour's pos…

Our country is facing a national emergency. Together @CBItweets & @The_TUC representing millions of workers and tens of thousands of businesses have written to @theresa_may demanding urgent change in her Brexit approach. https://t.co/XKFGgNQqZj

The car industry is going through its biggest upheaval in a century. UK has a huge opportunity to excel but this will only happen if we invest in R&D, in partnership between business & government – including in the upcoming Spending Review. #AdvWorld

We’re 10 days away from leaving the European Union. This is still written into the law of the land. Our position as a business community is clear. We urgently need certainty. No-deal would be an economic wrecking ball, just at a time when we need it least. #AdvWorld
RT @CBItweets: On 28 March, @cbicarolyn  will make a landmark speech - giving the business view on Labour’s plan to renationalise our railw…
RT @BBCr4today: A no deal Brexit is a "sledgehammer hanging over business" and needs to be ruled out today, says @cbicarolyn from @CBItweet…

Enough is enough. A new approach needed. Extend article 50 with a clear plan for progress: Conservatives must consign red lines to history, Labour must come to table with genuine commitment to solutions. It’s time to stop this circus.

To cut university fundin…

A cut in tuition fees would be a gross abrogation of responsibility. More young people from poorer families are now going to university. If politicians fan the flame of fear about the cost, they could end up deterring the very people who benefit most. https://t.co/icI5fyCdLt

How student finance works needs to be much clearer so that young people can make informed decisions about their futures. Today's work @MartinSLewis @russellgroup is a welcome part of the solution. @VictoriaLIVE https://t.co/9BQqgkRrOW

Moves to avert no deal in March are essential. There are now proposals from Parliament and Government. But they are just one step. To avoid a hammer blow to firms & livelihoods, delay cannot simply be an extension of stalemate. Compromise is the only way.

Business desperately wants a deal. But if no agreement found, delay will be only responsible choice. No deal is a wrecking ball for firms and communities and must be averted. But more time must not mean more gridlock – a clear plan is needed.
Another day of failed politics, another day closer to no deal chaos. Politicians must find a deal that protects our economy. Failure would be unforgivable.

Business leaders tell us all the time: they want to do much more to give young people the experiences of work they need early on in life.

CBI will publish a practical toolkit giving businesses  the information they need to get involved in education. @royalsociety

In a world where few employers even ask for GCSE results and there are better ways of assessing schools, why should we require pupils to cram for a set of exams which feel increasingly anachronistic? @royalsociety
RT @royalsociety: Thank you for speaking at our #ChangingEducation event. It's great to have expert insight from employers and businesses o…

Great to be speaking at @royalsociety business forum. The Royal Society are right to call for a review of post 16 education. We must get this right to deliver the high skilled jobs we need now and in the future to keep the UK economy competitive. https://t.co/OgPZP9zWp4

RT @SophyRidgeSky: Cracking @RidgeOnSunday line-up this week... 
✅ Tony Blair 
✅ Chief Sec to the Treasury @trussliz 
✅ Shadow Health Sec @…

Happy Chinese New Year to all our members, and businesses operating in and with China. Our @CBIBEIJING Sterling Assets report shows the UK is well ahead of the curve in making the most of its relationship with one of the world’s fastest-growing economies https://t.co/C7x7WzAnO6

Another deeply frustrating day for business. Renegotiation is a throw-of-the-dice, it must succeed or fail fast. Rejecting no deal is welcome but doesn’t get a deal. Until MPs can agree a solution, the threat of no deal will continue to drain money from the UK.

Britain is a great place to do business. It’s good to hear @PhilipHammondUK speak about that today. As we look to the future we must also focus on the imminent risk the UK economy faces & take a damaging, reckless No-Deal Brexit off the table.

No deal in March 2019 must be off the table. Both sides need to step back from their entrenched positions. They must focus on 3 key principles: a deal that commands consensus in Parliament, can be negotiated with the EU & protects the livelihoods of communities across the UK.

This is another bleak day for business. Government’s move to consult more widely is welcome, as is the commitment to scrap the settled status charge for EU citizens, but the fundamentals have not changed. Parliament remains in deadlock while the slope to a cliff edge steepens.

Every business will tonight feel no deal is hurtling closer. A new plan is needed immediately. Now is the time for our politicians to make history as leaders. All MPs need to reflect on the need for compromise and to act at speed to protect the UK's economy.

Ahead of next week's vote I sat down with @prospect_uk to discuss broader implications of #Brexit for business. Calling on politicians of all parties to put economy first. Increasing competitiveness + productivity growth remain urgent. Full interview: https://t.co/Mm2DEcuHYe

The duty to ensure an orderly exit is now in parliament’s hands. Each MP is democratically chosen to safeguard the prosperity of our country.

Next week, they face a test. 

If they meet it with yet more brinkmanship, the whole country could face a no-deal, disorderly Brexit.

Business Secretary @GregClarkMP reflects the voice of business. 1000’s of firms in despair at prospect of no deal. Rising costs & border disruption will cost jobs for years to come. Business will work with PM’s deal. If politicians can’t, they must find a way to stop no deal.

tweets.text: Today, Sainsbury's has announced its commitment to  become a Net Zero business by 2040, with an investment of £1 billion over the next twenty years. Find out more here: https://t.co/vvZKcpUJX5 https://t.co/H8nuKRU3nP

We’re removing 67m pieces of plastic by replacing tinned multipacks with plastic-free multibuys. Same value for money, just without plastic. It’s part of our goal to remove 1bn pieces of plastic by the end of this year. Find out more: https://t.co/jqaA4KpY89 https://t.co/AybYIV6ehE

🇬🇧 needs an immigration system that works on day 1. 

We look forward to working with the new government to inform the design of a new immigration system in a way that commands confidence & supports UK’s ambitions. #openandcontrolled https://t.co/J5Hn0HCzKT

Although we are recognised as one of the world’s 100 most sustainable companies, we still have a lot of work to do. Ambition Zero Carbon is our newly launched strategy to reach zero carbon by 2025 in operations, and that is only the beginning. https://t.co/SzQNdrIAFy #WEF20 https://t.co/bPzMV50SqA
Thanks to Lloyds CEO Antonio Horta-Osorio for telling the BBC how his own experience of stress and exhaustion shaped Lloyds approach to mental health in the workplace. https://t.co/nWVMYCVch6
Facebook says it is to create 1,000 new jobs in the UK this year, delivering a vote of confidence in the UK economy ahead of #Brexit https://t.co/1CcqAVzZu3

"Each of us must commit to do more, in order for us to collectively achieve more.” - @satyanadella 🌎

Learn more about Microsoft's plan to be carbon negative by 2030: https://t.co/B72tmH6jbt #sustainability

Moving away from EU rules will mean different things for different businesses. Business stands ready to work with government to help ensure the right trade-offs are made. 
 Read more 👉 https://t.co/Z6rZgH7NaZ https://t.co/BPXt1j15we

"NI firms are breathing a collective sigh of relief. @CBI_NI will continue to work with policymakers & bring evidence to the table, so together we can deliver ambitious solutions to the economic & environmental challenges we face.” Read our full reaction 👉https://t.co/BaWn1QXXug https://t.co/2vOyxwOJ7H

“I’ve always valued employee ownership and my hope is we continue our growth as a private limited company that creates profit for social value and rewards each other.”– Our founder Peter Cooper shares his thoughts on the transition to employee ownership: https://t.co/LsXUuM1RxT https://t.co/MnqD9JDMCX

Kicking off a two-day conversation with businesses in the South West, @cbicarolyn is hosting a lunch with members. First item on the agenda? How can we work with the new Government to make this a decade of delivery. https://t.co/uMy18LbuYR

One year ago, it was calculated that it would take 108 years to close the global gender gap. How long do you think it will take now? Read the World Economic Forum's full Global Gender Gap Report here: https://t.co/YtGeseIGMY #gendergap20 https://t.co/TvT4zxFmFq
'A far cry from what science tells us is needed' - Lengthy UN climate talks end in compromise, and recrimination https://t.co/rZY1jrOWVf

Business have needed greater certainty for 3 years now. The election result has started to bring that. It will bring some green shoots back into economy.But there are massive unanswered questions. 
@cbicarolyn speaks to @SkyNews https://t.co/B8OFIrw7B7

“The real work starts now” @cbicarolyn on the BBC Radio4 Today programme moments ago. @CBILeaders will continue to educate leaders to help them navigate the coming weeks and months to understand the impact of the political, economic and policy environments on their businesses https://t.co/71q02pZp9K

I think the fact that we now have a Prime Minister with a very strong mandate to govern is welcome. We do have an opportunity to rebuild confidence, but I think all eyes be on what happens now. @cbicarolyn on @BBCRadio4 @BBCr4today https://t.co/hcoE7RMuk5

Local businesses do so much to support our economy. Here is to the strivers who have built something from nothing, employing people & helping pay for our public services along the way. Show your local small business support this #SmallBizSatUK! @SmallBizSatUK 🎉 https://t.co/eGFvisYdDn

It’s a huge “Red Letter Day” for us @astonmartin today.   We officially open our new factory in St.Athan South Wales for the production of our DBX.   Thank you to everyone in Wales for the welcome.  A truly proud moment.  Every DBX will have on the sill-plate, “Made in Wales” https://t.co/d6kLEdnE1c

"From the steam engine & smallpox vaccine to the telegraph, and the web, for much of our history the UK has been the most inventive country on earth. 
And business has played a big part."

@cbicarolyn tells the crowd today at the launch of our new 
report. https://t.co/5GElg8Z2gI https://t.co/VjGEzl68OD

📣BREAKING NEWS📣: Sky to develop major new studio at Elstree, expected to open in 2022.

The new space will:
👩‍💻Create 2000 new jobs
💰 Kickstart £3bn of investment in UK's creative economy
🎥Give us 14 sound studios over 32 acres

Read more ➡️ https://t.co/c1Zz1W7vhd https://t.co/id4ooFmx4D

Want to see what we thought of today’s #LabourManifesto? 
Read our response 👇
https://t.co/7sysN5pEul https://t.co/X9bJanecC4

On the morning of our Annual Conference @cbicarolyn speaks to @BBCRadio4 on why the main parties have not paid enough attention to business issues in the run up to the election and why today will change that. #CBI2019 https://t.co/2RiBhdGarW

What do businesses want to see from the political parties and their manifestos? @CBItweets Director General @cbicarolyn will be on the show to explain.

📺 @SkyNews
⏰ 8.30am tomorrow
#️⃣ #Ridge https://t.co/UyERPTUmxt

.@cbicarolyn responds to the latest women on boards data.
Heading into 2020, all firms should ensure they have diverse shortlists and that they’re doing everything possible to support people from all walks of life in their careers, from ground floor to boardroom. https://t.co/TidV5fgY8K
We can’t solve the climate emergency by simply making it someone else’s problem. @CBICarolyn speaking at the CBI #racetonetzero conference. https://t.co/Shr0Na0hWB

The panel for Any Questions @BBCPolitics @BBCRadio4 #bbcaq hosted by @ChrisMasonBBC with @ConorBurnsUK @cbicarolyn
@tnewtondunn @LadyBasildon is ready for an evening of passionate debate! https://t.co/hR93SrTH4W

Great to be at the launch of new @CBItweets report into the importance of our creative industries with @cbicarolyn and @NickyMorgan01. 

One of the jewels in the UK’s crown and a huge national asset 🙌 #CBIcreative https://t.co/LHoWONpYLH

🎦@cbicarolyn on @BBCr4today We cautiously welcome this deal which unlocks a transition period, guarantees rights of 4 million citizens living abroad & opens a pathway to a new EU/UK partnership. If this deal does pass - firms will do everything possible to make it work for 🇬🇧 https://t.co/Z0S0ugx8m1

Standing room only for the @CER_EU fringe event at the Conservative Party conference - "What route out of the Brexit maze?" with @cbicarolyn @RichardGrahamUK &
@GregHandsMP, chaired by @CER_Grant https://t.co/8DClFAErAH

.@CER_EU Conservative Party Conference fringe event on 'What route out of the Brexit maze?'
1 October 2019, 18.00-19.30
Exchange 11, Manchester Central, Manchester

Speakers: @cbicarolyn,  Richard Graham and @GregHands Chair: @CER_Grant 

https://t.co/oSjA6GDL5V

The business concern about no deal Brexit is not project fear. We need a deal. We are urging compromise across all political parties.
📽️@cbicarolyn on @CNBCi https://t.co/ZS1IAW285f
There is too much talk of all Brexit predictions being wrong. People deserve facts not fiction on Brexit. 👇 #FactCheck https://t.co/Oltt974ff3

Myth #3: It’s not true that No Deal ends uncertainty for business. 
No Deal makes uncertainty worse with endless arguments on tariffs, borders, Ireland, rules. A swamp as well as a cliff edge.

Myth #2: It's not true that the impact of No Deal can be eliminated
➡️Retailers have prepared but cannot guarantee no delays or food shortages. 
➡️Car industry facing 10% tariffs - will be smaller and mean fewer jobs.

Myth #1: It’s not true that business is or can be ‘ready’ for No Deal. 
 
➡️@fsb_policy surveys show majority small firms not prepared due to cost & complexity . 
➡️Even big firms that are ‘ready’ will be damaged.
People deserve fact not fiction about the impact of No Deal Brexit on 🇬🇧 business.  #FactCheck

👍@CapitaPlc's announcement to pay its employees the real Living Wage from next year shows businesses can be the foundation stone of communities - improving livelihoods, fueling ambition & driving investment. Where firms can afford to do so, they should follow suit. @cbicarolyn https://t.co/zgsKfSEiiw

Diverse boardrooms make better decisions. But increasingly, it is business that is turning the tide & leading the way on big challenges we face as a society @cbicarolyn wraps up tonight's #HelenAlexanderLecture https://t.co/GbfmsFbaAG

"I'm sometimes asked who inspires me - and I always say Helen, for all the reasons I’ve talked about this evening.  If we are to increase trust in business, we need more people like Helen in business." @ITV's Carolyn McCall concludes this year's #HelenAlexanderLecture https://t.co/tMpg0QG62B

CBI members understand that politicians are facing desperately hard choices and want them to hear the economic evidence direct. This is not politics, spin or “Project Fear” scare tactics. It is what British businesses are saying. @cbicarolyn in @FT https://t.co/bcFBDszYsd https://t.co/2M86jnYmjQ

➡️ @cbicarolyn & @angela_mcgowan have been in Belfast to hear from NI members about preparations for a no deal #Brexit.

🎥 Carolyn gives her instant reaction

Firms need a deal which secures a frictionless border, continued access to talent & promotes peace and prosperity. https://t.co/PhKUf6oZXD

In Belfast this afternoon with @cbicarolyn, @angela_mcgowan & John Foster for the last of our #Brexit round tables this week. We’re hearing first hand from NI businesses about the impact of a no deal #Brexit https://t.co/Ombddr2Z7s
Great meeting with @Ibec_irl today in Belfast.  Unanimous agreement that getting a #Brexit deal must be UK/EU priority https://t.co/siiLSAGX7d
🎥Smaller businesses in West Midlands simply do not have the budget nor staff to prepare for a no deal Brexit, listen to what one member had to say to @cbicarolyn https://t.co/HhkBdDaN4S

Excellent and honest roundtable. Challenges ahead. Some can be tackled, some simply can’t. And most importantly, long term impact of no deal on uks reputation is a huge risk. Biz concerns must be listened to and acted on, but only a deal will protect prosperity https://t.co/cNyZJp958l
Great to be in Cardiff with @cbicarolyn and @josh_hardie for the 8th regional roundtable this week. We are hearing from businesses about the impact of a no-deal Brexit. https://t.co/kzk34pjPhu

This afternoon @cbicarolyn & @josh_hardie have been in Cardiff to hear from members about preparations for a no-deal Brexit. 

👉 Firms want certainty. That means clarity on what happens to things like data. Also important to maintain access to skills and treat EU staff fairly. https://t.co/PWThWuuOyL

This evening @cbicarolyn & @josh_hardie have been in Leicester to hear from members about preparations for a no-deal Brexit. 

📽️Carolyn gives her reaction

👉 The depreciation of 💷 is a real concern. Further no-deal related fluctuation will cause real damage.

Now on to Bristol https://t.co/QtTXe0eRKW
Great to have @cbicarolyn and @josh_hardie in Leicester for our 6th regional roundtable hearing from businesses about the impact of a no-deal Brexit. https://t.co/XaN1dT8D94

Looking forward to hosting @cbicarolyn in the #SW on Wednesday morning at @BurgesSalmon - an important opportunity for businesses to share their latest #Brexit insights. @CBItweets @DeborahJFraser https://t.co/bohmdShNuf

🎥Manufacturers in the North would be severely impacted in a no deal Brexit. @cbicarolyn has been speaking to businesses around the NE, the issue of tariffs and chaos at borders remain a serious long term problem. https://t.co/Dt4CLPj8Nr

Great to have @cbicarolyn and @RainNewtonSmith in Birmingham, the heart of the West Midlands, for our 5th regional roundtable hearing from businesses about the impact of a no-deal Brexit. https://t.co/J2HlV4sOzw

This afternoon @cbicarolyn has been in Birmingham to hear from members about preparations for a no-deal Brexit. 
🔷 New theme from this meeting 👉 real concern about the end of free movement before a replacement has been designed

📽️Carolyn gives her reaction. Now on to Leicester https://t.co/CJ7JkqPMjt

@cbicarolyn  says one of the breaks on productivity, which drives pay and living standards, is the lack of connectivity. We will be urging the Government to invest in northern infrastructure 🚆 https://t.co/vMpNdfQacA

"Not scaremongering" CBI Director General Carolyn Fairbairn @cbicarolyn tells @RogerJ_01 that a no-deal Brexit would take £20 billion out of the NW economy over next few years. She met with NW business leaders this morning. https://t.co/oEZhNUuZFL

This morning @cbicarolyn has been in Manchester to hear from our members about preparations for a no-deal Brexit.

.@cbicarolyn: “If the government was to reduce tuition fees without a commensurate increase in funding it would do profound harm. 

Harm to our universities, to students, and, ultimately, to our economy.” 

#Post18Review https://t.co/UMV1r51UQb

.@cbicarolyn: “We now have record participation in university among young people from poorer backgrounds.

If politicians fan the flames of fear about the cost of university they could end up deterring the very people who could most benefit from university.”

#Post18Review https://t.co/bxM4sDldHh

@cbicarolyn praised @CRC and FE Colleges - “to meet the needs of a flexible, modern economy the education system itself must become more flexible. It’s something that colleges like this already understand.” https://t.co/0zrY689xYH

.@cbicarolyn: “Our universities are a precious national asset. They should be protected and nurtured.

To cut university funding back further at this time would be a gross abrogation of responsibility.”

#Post18Review https://t.co/efJBrWLRVf

.@cbicarolyn: “At the CBI, we’re starting to ask whether the government should give people an entitlement to an extra qualification.
